articles.title: 'Minari' Broke New Ground for Storytellers of Color, But Creatives Don't Want to Be Pigeonholed - Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: The Oscar-nominated film navigates the immigrant American journey, but writer-director Lee Isaac Chung, producer Christina Oh and Steven Yeun emphasize its themes are broader than the Asian American experience: "We were just trying to tell something honest."
articles.content: It was a church scene that first caught producer Christina Oh's attention when she was introduced to the Minariscript in February 2019 by the film's future star, Steven Yeun. In the handful of pages … [+22480 chars]

articles.title: Singapore braces for deluge of container ships sailing from Suez - The Star Online
articles.description: SINGAPORE (Bloomberg): One of Asia’s busiest ports is preparing for an influx of ships after a week-long blockage at the Suez Canal.
articles.content:
